Dear District 135 Families,

As the school year comes to an end, we are sad that we won’t see all of the smiling faces of our students one last time before summer. We hope that everyone has been able to say goodbye to their classmates and teachers this week.

For our last District-wide challenge, we are inviting families to share their last day of school photos with us! Take a last day of school picture of your child(ren) and email the picture to ewillner@orland135.org by the end of the day Sunday, May 31st. Along with your photo, please include your child(ren)’s name(s) and school(s). We will randomly select 10 winners!

We can’t wait to see our students one last time as we begin summer break. We hope all of our Orland families have a safe and healthy summer.

Thank You!

A message from the Orland Park Police Department:

Dear School District 135 Families:
The police department is seeking the assistance of Orland School District 135 families. We are asking that you lock your vehicles when parked on your driveway and on the street, and to never leave your keys in any vehicle. Thieves have taken many valuable articles from unlocked cars and stolen cars that have had the keys left in them. The thieves may also use garage door openers to enter residences. Additionally, sometimes these thieves have used stolen cars in the commission of other crimes. These crimes are completely preventable by locking your vehicles while parked outside, never leaving your keys in your vehicle, and always concealing valuables in the vehicle. Remember if you don’t lock it, you could lose it. We ask that if you see something, you say something so that we can prevent more crimes from occurring. Thank you for your cooperation.

It's TEACHER TUESDAY featuring Breanna Coe, music and choir teacher at Liberty School!

"I have been teaching music and choir at Liberty for 16 years and have grown to really love the intermediate grade levels. The children are so creative and expressive and I love being able to help them tap into and develop a new side of themselves through music education. I am certified in the Orff Schulwerk pedagogy, which allows my students to learn about music through singing, speaking, moving, and playing instruments. I strive always to follow the advice of Carl Orff himself, who said, "Let the children be their own composers." Thank you to fellow OSD135 music teacher Penny Johnson for introducing me to this amazing pedagogy and for being such a wonderful mentor, and thank you to all the students at Liberty School for making music with me every day!" - Coe

TEACHER TUESDAY: This week's featured staff member is Katie Siebert, the nurse at High Point School!

"I couldn’t be more excited to work with the students at High Point. I’ve been a Pediatric Nurse for the last 14 years. My career started in the Pediatric Intensive Care Unit at Children’s Memorial in Chicago and was followed by working in a private clinic for the last 12 years. Having decided to move to the Suburbs in 2013 to start a family, I have been fortunate enough to stay working part-time in a private clinic while also being at home with my two sons John (4) and Colin (2). When presented with the chance to work at High Point, I saw the perfect opportunity to both continue my career in pediatrics while being able to help kids grow and thrive in an educational setting. Everyone at High Point has been incredibly welcoming. My passion for pediatrics and love of working with children has made this the perfect match. I look forward to seeing their smiling faces every day." - Siebert

TEACHER TUESDAY is BACK with a double feature from Centennial! Laura Kolpak and Shelah Hoblin will both be retiring this year, and we wish them a great final year in #OSD135!

"I’ve been lucky enough to be a part of district 135 since kindergarten. I’ve enjoyed teaching over 800 students since 1986. The community, staff, and students have enriched my life. The memories I’ve made will last my lifetime." - Kolpak

"I have been teaching 2nd grade in Orland Park since 1986! I worked at Park for my first 10 years in the district and the rest of my time has been at Centennial. I really enjoy sharing my love of reading and science with the students. Seeing their eyes sparkle at a new story or a fun experiment always makes my day! I have worked with wonderful, supportive people throughout the district, and I am proud to say I am a teacher in Orland Park. I’m looking forward to a wonderful school year as I get ready to retire after 37 years of teaching (34 in Second Grade in Orland Park)!" - Hoblin
